No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file access capabilities are present. The skill provides configuration examples and best practices for AI assistants to reference.

content.user_title: Optimize WordPress for Core Web Vitals
content.value_statement: Slow WordPress sites hurt user experience and search rankings. This skill provides proven techniques for image compression, caching configuration, asset optimization, and speed testing to achieve excellent Core Web Vitals scores.
actual_capabilities: Analyze and improve Core Web Vitals metrics (LCP, INP, CLS)
Configure image compression with WebP conversion and lazy loading
Set up page caching with LiteSpeed Cache and Redis object cache
Optimize CSS and JavaScript delivery with defer and preload techniques
Automate speed testing using PageSpeed Insights API and Lighthouse CLI
Configure CDN settings with Cloudflare performance features
limitations: Does not execute code on WordPress servers directly
Does not install or configure plugins automatically
Does not modify production databases without explicit approval
Does not provide real-time performance monitoring

output_examples.input: How can I improve my WordPress site LCP score?
output: • Compress hero image to WebP format under 100KB
• Preload the LCP image with <link rel="preload">
• Defer non-critical JavaScript to prevent render blocking
• Use a CDN with Brotli compression enabled
• Consider upgrading to Redis object cache for database queries

best_practices: Always test performance changes on a staging site before deploying to production
Use the PageSpeed Insights API to establish baseline metrics before and after optimizations
Combine multiple optimization techniques together for cumulative performance gains
anti_patterns: Installing too many optimization plugins that conflict with each other
Enabling aggressive minification without testing for broken layouts
Setting extremely long cache TTLs without proper cache invalidation strategies

faq.question: Does this skill work with all WordPress hosting providers?
faq.answer: Yes, the techniques work on shared hosting, VPS, and managed WordPress hosts. Some advanced features like Redis require server-level access.

faq.question: What are the minimum Core Web Vitals thresholds for passing?
faq.answer: LCP under 2.5s, INP under 200ms, and CLS under 0.1 are considered good scores in Google PageSpeed Insights.

faq.question: Can I use these optimizations with page builders like Elementor?
faq.answer: Yes, but additional care is needed. Disable page builder assets on pages where they are not needed and use selective loading techniques.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these optimization techniques?
faq.answer: All optimizations are read-only guidance. The skill does not execute code on your server or modify databases automatically.

faq.question: Why is my score fluctuating between tests?
faq.answer: Variability is normal due to network conditions, server load, and third-party scripts. Run tests multiple times and use the median result.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a performance expert?
faq.answer: This skill provides the same techniques and configuration examples. A human expert adds judgment for complex issues and faster troubleshooting.
